00025 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_tag_h__
00026 #define INCLUDE_git_tag_h__
00027 
00028 #include "common.h"
00029 #include "types.h"
00030 #include "oid.h"
00031 #include "object.h"
00032 
00033 /**
00034  * @file git2/tag.h
00035  * @brief Git tag parsing routines
00036  * @defgroup git_tag Git tag management
00037  * @ingroup Git
00038  * @{
00039  */
00040 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00041 
00042 /**
00043  * Lookup a tag object from the repository.
00044  *
00045  * @param tag pointer to the looked up tag
00046  * @param repo the repo to use when locating the tag.
00047  * @param id identity of the tag to locate.
00048  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00049  */
00050 GIT_INLINE(int) git_tag_lookup(git_tag **tag, git_repository *repo, const git_oid *id)
00051 {
00052         return git_object_lookup((git_object **)tag, repo, id, (git_otype)GIT_OBJ_TAG);
00053 }
00054 
00055 /**
00056  * Close an open tag
00057  *
00058  * This is a wrapper around git_object_close()
00059  *
00060  * IMPORTANT:
00061  * It *is* necessary to call this method when you stop
00062  * using a tag. Failure to do so will cause a memory leak.
00063  *
00064  * @param tag the tag to close
00065  */
00066 
00067 GIT_INLINE(void) git_tag_close(git_tag *tag)
00068 {
00069         git_object_close((git_object *) tag);
00070 }
00071 
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * Get the id of a tag.
00075  *
00076  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00077  * @return object identity for the tag.
00078  */
00079 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_tag_id(git_tag *tag);
00080 
00081 /**
00082  * Get the tagged object of a tag
00083  *
00084  * This method performs a repository lookup for the
00085  * given object and returns it
00086  *
00087  * @param target pointer where to store the target
00088  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00089  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00090  */
00091 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tag_target(git_object **target, git_tag *t);
00092 
00093 /**
00094  * Get the OID of the tagged object of a tag
00095  *
00096  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00097  * @return pointer to the OID
00098  */
00099 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_tag_target_oid(git_tag *t);
00100 
00101 /**
00102  * Get the type of a tag's tagged object
00103  *
00104  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00105  * @return type of the tagged object
00106  */
00107 GIT_EXTERN(git_otype) git_tag_type(git_tag *t);
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * Get the name of a tag
00111  *
00112  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00113  * @return name of the tag
00114  */
00115 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_tag_name(git_tag *t);
00116 
00117 /**
00118  * Get the tagger (author) of a tag
00119  *
00120  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00121  * @return reference to the tag's author
00122  */
00123 GIT_EXTERN(const git_signature *) git_tag_tagger(git_tag *t);
00124 
00125 /**
00126  * Get the message of a tag
00127  *
00128  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00129  * @return message of the tag
00130  */
00131 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_tag_message(git_tag *t);
00132 
00133 
00134 /**
00135  * Create a new tag in the repository from an OID
00136  *
00137  * @param oid Pointer where to store the OID of the
00138  *      newly created tag
00139  *
00140  * @param repo Repository where to store the tag
00141  *
00142  * @param tag_name Name for the tag; this name is validated
00143  * for consistency
00144  *
00145  * @param target OID to which this tag points; note that no
00146  *      validation is done on this OID. Use the _o version of this
00147  *      method to assure a proper object is being tagged
00148  *
00149  * @param target_type Type of the tagged OID; note that no
00150  *      validation is performed here either
00151  *
00152  * @param tagger Signature of the tagger for this tag, and
00153  *  of the tagging time
00154  *
00155  * @param message Full message for this tag
00156  *
00157  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise.
00158  *      A tag object is written to the ODB, and a proper reference
00159  *      is written in the /refs/tags folder, pointing to it
00160  */
00161 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tag_create(
00162                 git_oid *oid,
00163                 git_repository *repo,
00164                 const char *tag_name,
00165                 const git_oid *target,
00166                 git_otype target_type,
00167                 const git_signature *tagger,
00168                 const char *message);
00169 
00170 
00171 /**
00172  * Create a new tag in the repository from an existing
00173  * `git_object` instance
00174  *
00175  * This method replaces the `target` and `target_type`
00176  * paremeters of `git_tag_create` by a single instance
00177  * of a `const git_object *`, which is assured to be
00178  * a proper object in the ODB and hence will create
00179  * a valid tag
00180  *
00181  * @see git_tag_create
00182  */
00183 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tag_create_o(
00184                 git_oid *oid,
00185                 git_repository *repo,
00186                 const char *tag_name,
00187                 const git_object *target,
00188                 const git_signature *tagger,
00189                 const char *message);
00190 
00191 /** @} */
00192 GIT_END_DECL
00193 #endif
